item.text: The Lord showed me two baskets of figs sitting before his temple. This happened after King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon deported Jehoiakim’s son, King Jeconiah of Judah. He deported him and the leaders of Judah from Jerusalem, along with the craftsmen and metal workers, and took them to Babylon.

<st data-num="0259" class="">One</st> <st data-num="01731" class="">basket</st> had <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">good-looking</st> <st data-num="08384" class="">figs</st> in it. <st data-num="08384" class="">They</st> looked like <st data-num="01073" class="">those that had ripened early</st>.<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="0259" class="">other</st> <st data-num="01731" class="">basket</st> had <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">bad-looking</st> <st data-num="08384" class="">figs</st> in it, <st data-num="0834" class="">so</st> <st data-num="07455" class="">bad</st> they could <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st>.
The Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I answered, “I see figs. The good ones look very good. But the bad ones look very bad, so bad that they cannot be eaten.”
The Lord’s message came to me,
“I, the Lord, the God of Israel, say: ‘The exiles of Judah whom I sent away from here to the land of Babylon are like those good figs. I consider them to be good.

I will <st data-num="07760 05869">look</st> <st data-num=" 05921">after</st> their <st data-num="02896" class="">welfare</st><n id="1" /> and will <st data-num="07725" class="">restore</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>. There I will <st data-num="01129" class="">build</st> them <st data-num="01129" class="">up</st> and will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02040" class="">tear</st> them <st data-num="02040" class="">down</st>. I will <st data-num="05193" class="">plant</st> them firmly in the land<n id="2" /> and will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05428" class="">uproot</st> them.<n id="3" />
I will give them the desire to acknowledge that I am the Lord. I will be their God, and they will be my people. For they will wholeheartedly return to me.’

“I, the Lord, also solemnly assert: ‘King Zedekiah of Judah, his officials, and the people who remain in Jerusalem or who have gone to live in Egypt are like those bad figs. I consider them to be just like those bad figs that are so bad they cannot be eaten.

I will <st data-num="05414" class="">bring</st> such <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st> on them that <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04467" class="">kingdoms</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> will be <st data-num="02113" class="">horrified</st>. I will make them an <st data-num="02781" class="">object of reproach</st>, a <st data-num="04912" class="">proverbial example</st> of disaster. I will make them an <st data-num="08148" class="">object of ridicule</st>, an <st data-num="07045" class="">example to be used in curses</st>.<n id="1" /> That is how they will be remembered <st data-num="03605 04725 0834 08033">wherever</st> I <st data-num="05080" class="">banish</st> them.<n id="2" />
I will bring war, starvation, and disease on them until they are completely destroyed from the land I gave them and their ancestors.’”
